IBM has requested this be fixed in wtp 2.0.2.  The NPE is preventing the adopter's tools from inserting css styles via the property view when editing css in an html file.

This is probably due to an assumption somewhere in our code that you can only insert css styles via the properties view when you're editing css in the css editor (not html editor)

Marking as hotbug and targetting wtp 2.0.2.

Created an attachment (id=79970)
css.core.css.core.tests.patch

StyleDeclarationFormatter assumed that all css nodes had a model associated with it.  This was an incorrect assumption because it is actually possible to have a css style declaration node with no model associated with it.

The fix was to add null checks to when getting the associated model from a css node.  This fixes the NPE problem reported.  If there is no model associated with the css node, we just do default action, which is usually just don't format.

I also added a unit test to safeguard us from running into this problem again.
Looks good, especially the unit test.
fix released to wtp 2.0.2 & wtp 3.0 m3
